instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message:
No liquid but there was pysical damage caused by someone who took a drilll to the battery screws. PP3V42 inductor was off the board and also a short around the ISL.
Repaird that and now powers and works fine but....

No backlight after sleep / on wake. Light through the back shows wallpaper.

What signal is missing here please?

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message: Just checking you started with PRAM & SMC reset ?

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Gurmon, post: 22306"]Just checking you started with PRAM & SMC reset ?[/QUOTE]

Of course. There is nothing wrong with the backlight from startup and it's fine as long as you don't let it sleep. As soon as it sleeps and the backlight goes off it stays off even when you wake the Mac and can see an image on the screen the backlight does not come  back on, Restart it again and all good. It's just a sleep / wake thing.

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message:
There is no brightness control at all.
Also when sleep for a while, no backlight AND no image on wake.

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message: What are the chances of a dying GPU?

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22340"]What are the chances of a dying GPU?
[/QUOTE]

Really? ...

threads.title: 820-2915 No backlight on Wake
threads.message: Why not? Heat it up and see if issues disappear.
